overview: This subject addresses the application of pharmacokinetics and dynamics to clinical practice and introduces students to regulation and governance of prescribing, therapeutic planning across the life span, medication safety and risk and error management. This subject includes practical application of this knowledge in class and clinical practice and includes Integrated Professional Practice (IPP) hours.

assessments.description: Completion of 20 hours of Integrated Professional Practice (IPP). 20 hours. Hurdle requirement:. Completion of 20 hours of Integrated Professional Practice (IPP)
Medication prescribing competency assessment. 1000 words. Hurdle requirement:. Students must pass this assessment to pass the subject.

Semester 2.Contact hours: 36 hrs contact synchronous time consisting of: 24 hours of synchronous lectures; 8 hours of online content modules; and 4 hours of online case studies.

Prescribed texts: There are no prescribed texts for this subject.

Recommended texts and other resources: A list of recommended readings will be provided upon commencement.
